alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 21 at 3:54PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: .Significant Flooding Continues In Southern Santa Barbara County Tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST FRIDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will continue into the overnight hours. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Southern Santa Barbara. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Area roadways continue experiencing flooding. Inundation of businesses and homes has occurred. Additional heavy rain may prolong serious flooding tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 PM PST, widespread flooding continues from earlier very heavy rains across southern Santa Barbara County. Radar data indicate additional rounds of moderate to locally heavy rain spreading northward from the Pacific coastal waters. This activity is expected to continue into at least the early overnight hours, prolonging the risk for flooding. Landslides have occurred, with numerous rock and mud slides reported across the warning area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Barbara, Montecito, Santa Ynez, Carpinteria, Isla Vista, Summerland, El Capitan State Beach, Refugio State Beach, Goleta, Highway 154 over San Marcos Pass, Mission Canyon, Santa Barbara Air[port, Hope Ranch, Lake Cachuma and Old Man Mountain. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
